The last parliamentary elections have fully demonstrated the will of the Azerbaijani people and once again reflected on the country's (cont) https://t.co/JA6Y5WNiA2
Today, Azerbaijan is one of the world's most select countries with high economic and social development indicators.
Azerbaijan is an influential country on the international scale and is recognized as a reliable partner.
Azerbaijan pursues an independent foreign policy, the will of the Azerbaijani people is based on this policy.
# Stability in Azerbaijan, security is provided and strengthened.
In recent years, serious steps have been taken to improve the judicial-legal system in Azerbaijan.
The judicial system of European countries is an example, and this positive experience should be applied in Azerbaijan as well.
Transparent and institutional reforms in Azerbaijan have narrowed down the square for corruption and bribery.
Azerbaijan is on the path of democracy, all freedoms are ensured in the country.
There are hundreds of media outlets in Azerbaijan, free internet, 75 percent of the population is internet users.

BREAKING: President Obama just took another huge step to #ActOnClimate by rejecting the #KeystoneXL pipeline.
"The pipeline would not make a meaningful, long-term contribution to our economy." —President Obama on rejecting the #KeystoneXL
"If Congress is serious about wanting to create jobs, this was not the way to do it." —President Obama on rejecting the #KeystoneXL
"The pipeline would not lower gas prices for American consumers." —President Obama on rejecting the #KeystoneXL
"In fact, gas prices have already been falling, steadily." —President Obama on rejecting the #KeystoneXL
"Today, in 41 states, drivers can find at least one gas station selling gas for less than $2 a gallon." —President Obama #KeystoneXL
"Shipping crude oil into our country would not increase America's energy security." —President Obama #KeystoneXL
"If we want to prevent the worst effects of climate change before it's too late, the time to act is now." —President Obama #ActOnClimate

I received with regret the news of the rupture of the dam in MG, occurred yesterday, that deeply affected the district of Bento Rodrigues, in Mariana.
Yesterday I also called the governor Fernando Pimentel, putting the federal government at the disposal of the state.
The Minister of National Integration and the National Secretary of Civil Defense have already been in the affected area this morning.
The Armed Forces, especially the Army, and the National Civil Defense are also in contact with the government. of MG to assist local needs.
The federal government will recognize the state of emergency of the city to allow the FGTS to serve the people affected.
I greet the spirit of solidarity of the Brazilian people, who have sent food and clothing to the homeless.
I offer my solidarity to the victims and their families. It is necessary to ascertain with rigor the causes and responsibilities of the accident.
